hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Jurisdiction Regulatory Momentum Timing
hypothesis_content.statement: When two major jurisdictions (UK + either EU or US) announce crypto regulatory progress within 10 trading days, and the second announcement occurs during a NEUTRAL regime with positive momentum, probability of BULL regime transition within 7 days exceeds 65%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Single jurisdiction regulatory news often gets absorbed, but coordinated/sequential regulatory progress across major markets creates narrative momentum that can overcome neutral regime inertia. The timing window creates urgency for sidelined capital.
entry_conditions: Second jurisdiction (EU via MiCA implementation or US via legislation/CFTC action) within 10 trading days
BTC 5-day RSI (14) between 45-65 (positive momentum but not overbought)
Crypto social sentiment (weighted) turns positive after second announcement

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BULL or 10% gain from second announcement close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops below pre-UK announcement level or regime transitions to BEAR
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 trading days after second announcement without regime transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Market fails to respond to sequential regulatory progress, or sells off on 'second opinion' rather than treating as confirmation.
